timeline.message: Add types to default exports in stories and add exports to prop interfaces

Add name to default export in index.tsx

All the places that refer to this call it main anyway, so
explicitly naming it so makes no difference to execution and
makes import/no-anonymous-default-export happy.

timeline.bodyText: Was that actually triggering a lint issue?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Yup! It was getting assigned as a const on line 411 and then on line 418 the same identifier is declared as a type. It triggered off @typescript-eslint/no-redeclare. The other one in this file was DateRange which was declared as an interface, but there was an import for a Material UI Icon called DateRange in there too.
replies.author: SammyIsConfused

replies.bodyText: Okay, good to know. As it makes sense that you can do this, but I've always wondered what's the idiomatic approach. I'm happy to be guided by ESLint - they're a good egg. 😉
replies.author: edalex-ian
